text: 0 0 Open Menu Close Menu Open Menu Close Menu Our Team Hector Feliciano ayala, founder Hector’s passion lies in using fitness and exercise as platforms to inspire people to live their best and most confident lives. His journey in fitness and performance training started as a young kid growing up in Puerto Rico, where he began to play basketball competitively at an early age. Hector played collegiate basketball at Christopher Newport University. His goal as a fitness, health, and performance coach is to find contentment and satisfaction in knowing that every day he is putting his best effort forward to empower people to live active lives while becoming fitter, stronger, and healthier. His favorite fitness move is kettlebell swings. Education & Certifications : Master's degree in Applied Exercise Science with a concentration in Strength and Conditioning Certified Personal Trainer through the National Academy of Sports and Medicine (NASM) Performance Enhancement Specialist (NASM) Corrective Exercise Specialist (NASM) Strength and Flexibility Coach (NASM) Prenatal and Postnatal Women’s Fitness Specialist (NASM) USAW L-1 Sports Performance Coach Certified Boxing Fitness Trainer through the Box-N-Burn Academy Certified Health Coach through the American Council on Exercise (ACE) Kathryn feliciano, Admin Kathryn helps with the administrative aspects of Hector’s Fitness Advantage. She supports Hector with client appreciation, financial aspects of the business, and website development. Kathryn loves the summertime, drinking cappuccinos, and exploring DC with Hector and their sons, Micah & Isaiah. Her favorite fitness move is running sprints on the treadmill! Finn McKay, intern Finn McKay's passion lies in using fitness and exercise as platforms to inspire people to become the best versions of themselves. Finn is a rising junior at Purdue University, majoring in kinesiology. Finn's ultimate career goal is to work in physical therapy, where he can directly impact others' lives by helping them recover and improve their physical health. Finn’s favorite fitness combination is bodybuilding and powerlifting. 0 0 Open Menu Close Menu Open Menu Close Menu training & coaching that helps you get strong & feel better personal training to help you live the life you want to live. our fitness advantage At HFA, we’re not about weight loss. we’re about building strength and feeling better so you can live life how you want to. We offer boutique in-person 1:1 and semi-private group training that helps our clients grow stronger and leave the studio feeling refreshed. HFA’s studio is equipped with all the latest equipment to give you every option for strength building. And, Hector will incorporate recovery aspects into your fitness experience. He will use stretching, percussion massage, and compression therapy to help you leave the studio feeling better than when you came in. What People Are Saying “Hector has been training me remotely for a year now. He is a wonderful trainer and coach. When I first began working with him I expressed my concerns about my lack of physical activity and my desire to start working out. Hector designed a program for my specific needs. He is working with me on toning by body with strength training and stretching. His goals for me are realistic and his workout routines are something I can achieve. Hector is great with giving feedback and suggestions that help with my training. He also answers any of my questions in a timely manner. Hector is showing me that with better nutrition and daily movement I will be able to reach my goals. I would highly recommend using Hector’s Fitness Advantage. I feel Hector really cares and wants you to be successful. Thank you Hector for all you have done for me!” — toney “Hector is a great coach. He works with you and helps you improve! He takes into consideration where you are in your journey and work schedule.” — Shay “For someone who is looking to stay fit, active, and toned, Hector is the perfect trainer. He offers a holistic approach to fitness which includes focusing on stretching, core work, weights and cardio - tailored to the client’s capability and interests. For me, boxing is my cardio of choice which gets my heart pumping and minimizes impact on my knees and feet. Finally, the ability to workout in person (either at my home or in his studio) or virtually on zoom makes training possible wherever I am and whenever I have time.” — Wes “We are fortunate to have Hector as our personal trainer! He asks a lot of questions about our health (in our 60s), lifestyle and goals. He helped us reach our first health goal in a few months, and we’re now working on our next goal! Thank you Hector - for not letting us off the hook when we’re feeling lazy! We appreciate you!” — Mitch & Tessy “Hector is a first class fitness coach! He is knowledgeable, available for consultation and able to offer adaptations to changing circumstances (e.g. recent injury) right away. I recommend him highly!” — Andrew training & coaching that helps you get strong & feel better strong personal training to help you live the life you want to live. our fitness advantage At HFA, we’re not about weight loss. we’re about building strength and feeling better so you can live life how you want to. 0 0 Open Menu Close Menu Open Menu Close Menu HFA Services Live 1:1 Training *There is currently a waitlist for 1:1 clients! Please see the HFA Lifestyle section for available slots.* HFA offers private 1:1 in person training at our boutique studio and recovery room. Hector has all the equipment necessary for both an excellent, strength-building workout and a body-relaxing recovery session. He incorporates strength training, mobility, stretching, percussion massage, and compression therapy. With an HFA 1:1 workout experience you will leave the studio feeling strong and refreshed. Semi-Private Group Training HFA offers semi-private training for groups of 2-4 clients at our fully equipped studio. This option is perfect for clients who want to work out with a few friends. And, it offers the benefits of personal training at a more affordable cost. HFA Lifestyle HFA Lifestyle is all about helping you achieve the lifestyle you want. Our program is designed to help you get strong and feel better. We help you practice healthy habits, coach you through an active mindset, and learn about nutrition for performance. At HFA, we don’t do weight loss. We do lifestyle change for a strong life. And that is what we target with this program. Our nutrition is about eating enough to fuel your body and feel better in your skin. You can participate in two ways: Through our hybrid option. You train in the studio with Hector once a week, and you participate in the HFA Lifestyle program in our HFA app. You participate solely in the HFA Lifestyle program in our HFA app. No matter which set up works best for your busy schedule, with HFA Lifestyle you’ll get the results you’re looking for. 0 0 Open Menu Close Menu Open Menu Close Menu mission To help our clients get strong, feel better, and enjoy fitness as a lifestyle HFA Pillars Exercise Daily movement through physical activity helps us feel better, function better, and sleep better. Regular movement reduces the risk of many chronic diseases and can even help improve concentration and mental well-being. Even short episodes of physical activity are beneficial for healthy joints, strong bones, physical strength, and good circulation. HFA can help you increase your movement through workouts tailored to you that are designed to help you achieve your goals and have fun. Lifestyle Fitness is not limited to your daily workout. Fitness helps you have more life! In our remote coaching programs, we aim to help you make fitness a lifestyle. We believe that long-term success depends on the client’s lifestyle and mindset. We will work with you to incorporate fitness into your everyday life through physical activity, nutrition, and behavior change. Recovery We want our clients to not only get stronger but to also feel great. That’s why we also emphasize recovery work. Hector builds recovery into the client’s fitness experience. From assisted stretching to percussion massage to compression therapy, our clients leave the studio feeling both strong and refreshed. mission To help our clients get strong, feel better, and enjoy fitness as a lifestyle HFA Pillars Exercise Daily movement through physical activity helps us feel better, function better, and sleep better. What does that mean for our clients? clients can now utilize their HSA/FSA funds, making HFA's custom tailored training more accessible and affordable. It's a significant stride in encouraging individuals to prioritize their health and fitness, with the added advantage of managing their healthcare spending more efficiently. our training approach improves your health Hector's Fitness Advantage presents a powerful solution for those seeking to reverse or prevent chronic conditions through its tailored, results-driven approach. Our personalized 1:1 and semi-private training approach is particularly effective for managing and preventing chronic conditions such as cardiovascular diseases, diabetes, and obesity. By incorporating strength training, cardiovascular exercises, and flexibility workouts, HFA's programs enhance overall fitness, boost metabolism, and improve body composition. These physical benefits are crucial in mitigating the risk factors associated with chronic illnesses. Additionally, HFA's commitment to accountability and motivation ensures that clients remain engaged and consistent in their fitness journey, further amplifying the positive impact on their health. utilize your health savings funds Our partnership with Truemed introduces a financially savvy way to invest in health. Qualified customers now have the opportunity to use their Health Savings Accounts (HSA) or Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) to cover the costs of HFA's training programs. This collaboration recognizes the role of personalized fitness in preventive healthcare and aligns with the philosophy that investing in physical well-being is a proactive step toward long-term health. get started with truemed now Here’s how you get started: Take this survey to see if you qualify. Most clients will qualify! The evaluation will cost $30. If qualified, you'll receive a Letter of Medical Necessity (LMN) from a licensed provider. With the LMN, you are able to reimburse your training costs with HSA/FSA dollars. Hector Feliciano - Published A-24-14 MISSION STATEMENT We are an independent branch of government constitutionally entrusted with the fair and just resolution of disputes in order to preserve the rule of law and to protect the rights and liberties guaranteed by the Constitution and laws of the United States and this State. 0 0 Open Menu Close Menu Open Menu Close Menu HOUSING: Jan 17 Written By CMHR Creation of truly permanent low-income dignified housing for all working-class New Yorkers. Focused on homeless single moms and households including working New Yorkers living in city shelter Fight Gentrification and displacement in our district Re-examine ULURP process to ensure transparency in our community, increase the power/influence of the Community Boards; give community boards a voting options for multiple members of the Planning Commission. Reduce the number of members the NYC Mayor can install; and demand a Racial impact study on all district developments and, expect housing plan uses more than AMI or 80/20 determinants. Continue fighting with NYS representatives on the growing deed theft and improper use of TPT (Third Party Transfer) NYCHA: Determine the validity of NYCHA evictions by the Permanent Affordability Commitment (PACT), private mangers, and the failure to implement standard operating procedures Expedite and improve the NYCHA repair process to better serve residents and enhance their quality of life by assigning high skilled trades for more efficient completion of repairs and establishing Neighborhood Planning Units to make it easier for residents to schedule skilled trades repair Tickets Decades of insufficient funding and deferred maintenance of New York City's public housing, I will work with the State to commit to obtaining capital investment of $78+ billion for the modernization and long-term sustainability of New York City's public housing Work with the Department of Housing, Preservation and Development (HPD) and the state Division of Homes and Community Renewal (DHCR) to prevent Mitchell-Lama housing from privatizing Reforming and strengthening City and State rent regulations to ensure tenants stay in their homes Work together with the legal aid society and housing attorneys working pro bono to institute tenants’ knowledge on evictions in our district. We will focus on the worst building owners in the district Work with state and city authorities to ensure Public Housing conditions are improved and fight against privatization of public housing Encourage and make a pathway for younger citizens first time home buyers, to obtain homeownership. Focused on black, indigenous, and people of color Include in the city budget, subsidized programs for district constituents to include One-Shot Deal and expedite help for individuals and families find and keep housing in New York City through CityFHEPS Consult directly with the community via townhall on land use issues Enact legislation to protect families living in public housing from eviction due to crimes that may be committed by visitors rather than residents I am calling for reform of the Rent Guideline Board. We have spent too many years under this impractical agency. Donate today Meet Hector Robertson Hector Robertson is running for the office of City Council for New York City’s District 35 in Brooklyn, representing the neighborhoods of Crown Heights, Prospect Heights, Clinton Hill, and Fort Greene. A longtime resident of Crown Heights Brooklyn and son of Jamaican and Panamanian immigrants, is seeking to become a public servant committed to making government more accessible for everyone in the district and across the city of New York. Hector’s commitment to public and community service is personal and had its beginning when he saw neighbors struggling to keep their housing while being abused and harassed by building owners. To centralized his efforts in helping the community, Hector founded the Washington Avenue Botanic Block Association (WABBA) and also the Crown Heights Community Council (CHCC) to provide information and resources for those affected tenants and anyone else who may need help. OVER THE YEARS, Hector has become a fierce advocate for older adults not understanding NYC red tapes regarding city services and for families impacted by the lack of low-income housing. Hector has an unwavering pledge to serving families who are in desperate need to keep a roof over their heads and keep their families safe. Hector has spent more than two decades working in the healthcare industry in the clinical trials space – first with reputable company such as Pfizer, Roche, Novartis and Siemens and later for various other Pharmaceutical, Biotech, Medical Device and Diagnosis companies and at the same time, involved in community service. Hector is a graduate and holds a degree from the University of Panama. He lives with his wife in the district he wishes to represent, Crown Heights. “ Putting Working Class First ” About Courage. 0 0 Open Menu Close Menu Open Menu Close Menu EDUCATION: Jan 17 Written By CMHR NYC educational system has 1,866 schools, approximate 260 charter schools, and 9 specialized high schools. Brooklyn has only one specialized school. My goal is to increase the number of specialized schools in our districts and to remedy the inequities of the admission system to these specialized schools New York City public high school graduation rate by Title 1 funding and populated by a high percentage of students from low-income families must be addressed. My goal is to visit these school to determine the needs to help make these schools increase their graduation rate Address the 30,000 asylum seekers and migrant student enrollment in NYC schools to ensure the city school budget addresses the cost for resources needed to address the education requirement of these children. The DOE spent $22 million on initiatives exclusively related to these students in FY 2023, despite not having budgeted for any such costs in that year Work on finding a practical solution in providing free CUNY education for marginalized students in the district and across the city Have a well-funded budget for virtual schooling for marginalized students in our district and across the city CMHR EDUCATION: Jan 17 Written By CMHR NYC educational system has 1,866 schools, approximate 260 charter schools, and 9 specialized high schools.
